Who doesn‚Äôt love being acknowledged on the global stage?

üèÜ GroupMappers, MORU, is featured in celebration of World Malaria Day 2023 by WHO news. üåçü¶ü

Check out the link below to read all about the malaria elimination efforts in Bangladesh!

üëâÔøΩÔøΩ <https://www.who.int/bangladesh/news/detail/05-07-2023-celebration-of-world-malaria-day-2023> 

 Thanks to the National Malaria Elimination Programme of Bangladesh for arranging this valuable event.

The two week long Diagnostic Network Optimization (DNO) training workshop, funded by FIND (Foundation for Innovative New Diagnostics) concluded on July 21st in Naivasha, Kenya.

GroupMappers, MORU is immensely grateful to FIND for providing this valuable opportunity to gain hands on training on Optidx. It is web-based, open-access tool empowers us to conduct diagnostic network and route optimization analysis for any disease, aligning diagnostic networks with national health goals and supporting universal health coverage efforts.

In low- and middle-income countries, basic diagnostic capacity is available in just 1% of primary care clinics and 14% of hospitals. Through Optidx, decision makers can now work towards expanding access, enhancing efficiency and managing costs effectively.

Equipped with this knowledge, GroupMappers,MORU is ready to share the expertise and experience in improving diagnostic capacity of HIV, Malaria, TB and other diseases in Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, South Africa, Zambia, Kenya, USA, Vietnam.

As part of year long activities the National Malaria Elimination and Aedes Transmitted Disease Control Program effectively carried out the Monsoon Aedes Survey.

The goal of this study was to collect vector data for micro-level planning to deal with dengue outbreaks.

GroupMappers is pleased to have contributed to this significant initiative. We are working together to provide the authorities with crucial information to tackle dengue during the monsoon season.

As the alarming cases of dengue continue to rise, let‚Äôs prioritize the cleanliness of our neighborhoods and utilize mosquito repellents and bed nets to ensure the safety and well-being of everyone.

NMEP, BRAC, and GroupMappers unite to celebrate The World Malaria Day, 2023. Honorable Health Minister Zahid Malek, alongside esteemed officials including CDC and DGHS Directors, grace the event.

Together, we‚Äôre making significant strides in the fight against malaria.

GroupMappers‚Äô innovative surveillance dashboard enhances monitoring efforts, providing real-time insights for effective resource distribution and healthcare worker deployment.

Let‚Äôs raise awareness, commemorate progress, and reaffirm our commitment to a malaria-free future.

Join us as we work towards a world without malaria.

GroupMappers had the privilege of attending the ‚ÄúWorkshop on Development of Malaria funding request to Global Fund (GC-7)‚Äù, organized by the National Malaria Elimination and Aedes Transmission Control Program of the Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS), Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoH&FW), supported by the World Health Organization (WHO).

Our team, along with BRAC Consortium and WHO, joined hands to discuss advancing malaria control efforts in Bangladesh with SMART Surveillance. At the workshop, we showcased how GroupMappers is assisting the NMEP (National Malaria Elimination Program) to collect micro stratified malaria data from villages. This data will help the program to make better interventions and have strong surveillance towards malaria elimination.

We are proud to be a part of this initiative and working towards a malaria-free Bangladesh.

Our CRP workshop has been successfully completed on the topic of ‚ÄúUse of Mobility Data for Guiding Public Health Responses‚Äù.

The workshop took place in Thailand on February 9 and 10, 2023.

The workshop‚Äôs main purpose was to use mobility data for public health purposes.

Our five-day training session in Lama, Bandarban, has completed successfully on ‚ÄúTechnical assistance in implementing village level data collection and surveillance towards malaria elimination in Lama upazila, Bandarban‚Äù.

In Bandarban‚Äôs Lama Upazila, we taught healthcare workers from these unions- Fasiyakhali, Faitang, Gajalia, Serai, Ruposhipara, and Lama upazila.

Health workers learned to send malaria data using the USSD system and kobo toolbox. To make it possible, a lot of support was provided by our field crew.

The Lama local authority also helped us out with the events.

We appreciate MORU and APMEN‚Äôs assistance and financial contribution to the training

A two-day workshop with FiND , ICCDR, B and NMEP on ‚ÄúApplying Diagnostic Network Optimisation Analysis‚Äù to inform the introduction of G6PD testing into Bangladesh for improved malaria treatment was held on December 14th and 15th, 2022.

The project‚Äôs aim was to support the National Malaria Elimination Program (NMEP) in Bangladesh by modeling an evidence-based strategy for introducing G6PD diagnosis that best uses available resources to ensure optimal access to testing by P. vivax patients and running the OptiDx baseline model to estimate the coverage and cost of potential scenarios for G6PD testing

‚ÄúMass Dog Vaccination Program (MDV)‚Äù from 30th November to 5th December, 2022

The five-day-long ‚ÄúMass Dog Vaccination (MDV)‚Äù under the National Rabies Control and Elimination Program, CDC, ZDCP and DGHS has begun yesterday, November 30th, in both Dhaka City Corporations, following the nationwide program.

This is the third round of mass vaccination for all owned and stray dogs, with the goal of attaining herd immunity in the dog population.

GroupMappers has been providing assistance to this program to support the field based data collection, training, monitoring, reporting and analysis to accelerate the elimination of rabies from Bangladesh since February of 2018.

GroupMappers is strongly committed to reducing the risk of fatal diseases such as rabies, and we would like to offer our sincere appreciation to the DGHS for providing us with such a wonderful opportunity and our super energetic volunteer team to work for animal welfare.

Jagannath University celebrates GIS Day, 2022, with the theme ‚ÄúShare your passion and inspire the world!‚Äù

Geography helps us understand our planet and interact with the world around us. It helps us figure out how things are, why they are where they are, and how cultural, economic, and political connections and movements affect us all.

Therefore, GroupMappers‚Äô principal objective is to maintain a geospatial perspective in order to see and work through problems.

Shout out to Jagannath University‚Äôs Geography and Environment Department for celebrating GIS Day with such enthusiasm and for getting students and teachers involved in spreading the power of GIS.

It gives us great pleasure to be able to sponsor the young team of JnU.

To encourage the volunteers, Mr. Sazid Ibna Zaman, co-founder of GroupMappers, Mr. Mohammad Abdul Hadi, Country Manager at Esri Bangladesh/Esri South Asia, Vice-Chancellor of Jagannath University Professor Md. Imdadul Hoque, treasurer Professor Kamaluddin Ahmed and chairman Dr. Md Abdul Quader and other teachers from the department were present.
